author: andygumbrecht
msg: Fixed (Possibly a Windows only issue) ClassLoader jar file locking issues which were caused by several factors.

1. ClassLoaderUtil was using wrong key to remove and close cached jar files, so added a first (most common) and fall-back strategy to create a valid removal key. Also added private method to close jar file loaders.
2. DeploymentLoader was not actually using the temp files it created to create the lookup ClassLoader.
3. DeploymentLoader was trying to delete temp jar files before jar file references had been removed.
All files are now unlocked (and can be deleted) as expected. Previously it was necessary to restart OpenEJB to redeploy an application with the same name.
